result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlance L Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 2 & consecutive to current sentence

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 2 & consecutive to current sentence

miscConds.notes: No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Engage in a recovery program. Once released must reside in a sober living facility. Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. May not reside with wife until agent deems it safe and appropriate after marriage counseling.   Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given. Cognitive thinking, counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Engage in a recovery program. Once released must reside in a sober living facility. Report to Racine Vocational Ministry. May not reside with wife until agent deems it safe and appropriate after marriage counseling.   Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given. Cognitive thinking, counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant Arlance L Triplett in court with attorney Helmi Hamad for Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Arlance L Triplett in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim, SLT (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Arlance L Triplett in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Arlance L Triplett in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
